
## Unlevered Beta and CAPM (Using Business Risk Only)

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

# Randomized parameters
set.seed(NULL)
beta_L <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 1.50, sd = 0.20), 2)        # levered beta
D_over_E <- round(runif(1, min = 0.30, max = 0.80), 2)      # debt-to-equity
tax <- round(runif(1, min = 0.20, max = 0.35), 2)           # corporate tax rate
rf <- round(runif(1, min = 0.02, max = 0.05), 2)            # risk-free (decimal)
rm <- round(runif(1, min = 0.08, max = 0.12), 2)            # market return (decimal)

beta_U <- beta_L / (1 + (1 - tax) * D_over_E)               # unlevered (asset) beta
Re_unlev <- rf + beta_U * (rm - rf)                         # CAPM with unlevered beta

beta_U_disp <- round(beta_U, 2)
Re_unlev_pct <- round(100*Re_unlev, 2)
```

A firm has **levered beta = `r beta_L`**, **D/E = `r D_over_E`**, **tax rate = `r round(100*tax,2)`**%.  
What is its **unlevered (asset) beta**? (Use the standard formula removing leverage.)

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q1a"><strong>1. Unlevered beta (no units):</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q1a" name="module4_num_q1a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 160px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r beta_U_disp` data-tolerance="0.1" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q1a" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ **Why this is the answer:** Unlevered beta measures **business risk only** (no financial leverage).  
We “strip out” leverage using: β<sub>U</sub> = β<sub>L</sub> / [1 + (1 – T) × (D/E)].  
This lets us compare firms **on operating risk**, independent of capital structure.  
**Your numbers:** β<sub>U</sub> = `r beta_L` / [1 + (1 − `r tax`) × `r D_over_E`] = **`r beta_U_disp`**.
</div>
:::

If the **risk-free rate** is **`r round(100*rf,2)`**% and the **expected market return** is **`r round(100*rm,2)`**%, what is the **expected return using CAPM with the unlevered beta**?

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q1b"><strong>2. Expected return (in %):</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q1b" name="module4_num_q1b" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 160px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r Re_unlev_pct` data-tolerance="0.1" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q1b" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ **CAPM intuition:** Investors require compensation for time value (**Rf**) and for bearing market risk (**β × MRP**).  
We use the **unlevered beta** to price the **business risk** without leverage:  
E[R] = R<sub>f</sub> + β<sub>U</sub> × (R<sub>m</sub> − R<sub>f</sub>) = **`r Re_unlev_pct`%**.  
This gives a **baseline cost of equity** for the project/asset **before** financing effects.
</div>
:::
